intro: Korthalsia flagellaris, commonly known as the flagellate korthalsia, is a small, flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Korthalsia flagellaris is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
